title: Nut (goddess)
summary: Nut /ˈnʊt/[2] (Ancient Egyptian: Nwt), also known by various other transcriptions, is the goddess of the sky, stars, cosmos, mothers, astronomy, and the universe in the ancient Egyptian religion. She was seen as a star-covered nude woman arching over the Earth,[3] or as a cow. She was depicted wearing the water-pot sign (nw) that identifies her.
